title: Global Digital Library - Book Catalog
description: The Global Digital Library (GDL) is being developed to increase the availability of high quality reading resources in languages children and youth speak and understand.

children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በፓክት ኢትዮጵያ (Pact Ethiopia) እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግስት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children) እና በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር ተሻሽሎ ታተመ።

children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: ስሜቶች
children.description: ስለ ልዩ ልዩ ሰዎችና ነገሮች ምን እንደሚሰማን እናንብብ፡፡ ልጆች እናንተ ስለጓደኞቻችሁም ሆነ በአቅራቢያችሁ ስላሉ ነገሮች ምን ይሰማችኋል?
children.author: Clare Verbeek, Thembani Dladla, Zanele Buthelezi, and Kathy Arbuckle

children.title: ፍየል፣ ዉሻና ላም
children.description: ፍየል፣ ዉሻና ላም በዚህች ቃላት-አልባ ተረት ምን ዓይነት ጸባይ ያሳያሉ?
children.author: Fabian Wakholi and Marleen Visser

children.title: ምን እየሰራህ ነው?
children.description: በአሁን ጊዜ ግሶች በተዋቀሩ አጫጭር አረፍተነገሮች የተቀመመች ተረት እነሆ!
children.author: Nina Orange and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: በጣም ረጅም ሰውዬ
children.description: በዚህ ታሪክ ውስጥ የምናገኘው ሰውዬ በጣም ረጅም በመሆኑ በአካባቢው ያለው ነገር ሁሉ በጣም ትንሽ ወይም በጣም አጭር ሆኖበታል፡፡ እንደሱው ትላልቅ የሆኑ ነገሮችን በመስራት ለዚህ ችግሩ መፍትሔ ይሰጠዋል፡፡
children.author: Cornelius Wambi Gulere and Catherine Groenewald

children.title: ድመቴ የታለች?
children.description: ድመቴ ጠፍታብኛለች፡፡ ወደሱ አካባቢ ትታያችኋለች እንዴ? ይህ ተረት በአጫጭር አረፍተ ነገሮች የተዋቀረ ልህጻናት የሚስማማ ተረት ነው፡፡ መልካም ንባብ፡፡
children.author: Clare Verbeek, Thembani Dladla, Zanele Buthelezi, and Bronwen Heath

children.title: የትምህርት ቤት ልብሶች
children.description: ትምህርት ቤት ተመልሼ ልገባ ስለሆነ ሁሉንም የትምህርት ቤት ልብሶቼን መለካት አለብኝ፡፡
children.author: Clare Verbeek, Thembani Dladla, Zanele Buthelezi, and Mlungisi Dlamini

children.title: የኤሊ አፍንጫ ለምን ተጣመመ?
children.description: ወደ ጠብ ለመግባት እጅግ አትቸኩሉ፡፡ (ይህ ተረት በሦስተኛ ደረጃ ተረቶች ዝርዝርም ውስጥ አለ፡፡)
children.author: Taiwo Ẹhinẹni and Marlene Visser

children.title: ጅብ፣ ጥንቸልና ሳፋዎቻቸው
children.description: ሳፋ መውለድ ከቻለ፤ ሕይወት አለው ማለት ነው፡፡ ሕይወት ያላቸው ሁሉ ይሞታሉ፡፡
children.author: Charles Katiwa Kiema

children.title: መብራቴና ከተማ
children.description: ይህ አስቂኝ ተረት ስለጓደኝነትና ከዘንጋዳ ዘለላ በጥረት ስለሚገኝ ጥቅም ይተርካል፡፡
children.author: Cornelius Gulere and Brian Wambi

children.title: ስንት?
children.description: ልጆች፣ በስዕሎቹ ላይ ስንት ነፍሳት፣ እንስሳት ወይንም ወፎች እንዳሉ ቁጠሩ፡፡
children.author: Clare Verbeek, Thembani Dladla, Zanele Buthelezi, and Sandra McDougall

children.title: እንሰሳትን እንቁጠር
children.description: መሰረታዊ ቁጥር አቆጣጠርንና የእንሰሳት መጠሪያ ስያሜዎችን ለማለማመድ የተዘጋጀ ስዕላዊ ተረክ ነው፡፡
children.author: Zanele Buthelezi, Thembani Dladla, Clare Verbeek, and Rob Owen

children.title: ደስ ያላችሁና የከፋችሁ አሁኑኑ … ንገሩኝ!
children.description: ሰዎችን የሚያስደስቷቸውንና የሚያስከፏቸውን ስሜቶች የሚዳስስ ንባብ
children.author: Madhav Chavan and Rijuta Ghate

children.title: ዝንጀሮና ድርቁ
children.description: ያለንን ለማጋራት ከፈቀድን ሁላችንም አብረን በሠላም መኖር እንችላለን፡፡
children.author: Alice Edui and Salim Kasamba

children.title: ያመለጡት እንስሳት
children.description: አራት በዕድሜ የገፉ እንስሳት ራሳቸውን ከጨቋኝ ጌቶቻቸው ነጻ ለማውጣት ተባበሩ፡፡ የእርጅና ዘመናቸውንም በሰላም ለማሳለፍ የሚችሉበትን ቦታ አገኙ፡፡
children.author: Cissy Kiwanuka Luyiga and Magriet Brink

children.title: የትኛው ስራ ይበልጣል?
children.description: አንዳንድ ስራዎች ከሌሎቹ ይበልጣሉን? (ይህ ተረት በሶስተኛ ደረጃ ተረትነትም ይገኛል፡፡)
children.author: Beatrice Inzikuru and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: ዋርዲት በቅሎዋ
children.description: በቅሎ ለምን ልጅ እንደማትወልድ የሚያስረዳ ተረት፡፡ (ይህን ተረት መጀመሪያ የተረኩልን መስፍን ሀብተማርያም ናቸው፡፡ ኤሊዛቤት ሊያርድ ደግሞ ወደ እንግሊዝኛ ተረጎሙት፡፡ )
children.author: Mesfin Habte-Mariam, Elizabeth Laird, and Marleen Visser

children.title: ጦጣና አዞ
children.description: ይህ ተረት አንዲት ጦጣ እንዴት ራሷን በአዞ ከመበላት እንዳዳነች ይተርካል፡፡
children.author: Mulualem Daba and Abraham Muzee

children.title: ድመቶችን እንቁጠር
children.description: Counting book, from zero to nine.
children.author: Nina Orange and Jesse Breytenbach

children.title: እንስሳቱን ተመልከቱ
children.description: የእንሰሳትን የተለያዩ ድምፆች የሚሳይ ስእላዊ መግለጫ ነው፡፡
children.author: Jenny Katz and Sandy Campbell

children.title: መምህሬ
children.description: ተማሪዎች ለመምህራቸው ያላቸውን ፍቅር የሚያሳይ ስራ ነው፡፡
children.author: Zimbili Dlamini, Hlengiwe Zondi, and Jesse Pietersen

children.title: ውለታቢሱ ቀበሮ
children.description: ጥንቸል በአስቸጋሪ ወቅት ቀበሮውን አዳነችው፡፡ ነገር ግን ቀበሮው ቃል በገባው መሰረት ለጥንቸል ውለታዋን መክፈል ሲገባው ቃሉን አጠፈ፣ መሃላውን አፈረሰ፡፡
children.author: Mohammed Kuyu, Elizabeth Laird, and Jacob Kono

children.title: እንቁራሪትና እባብ
children.description: አንዳንድ ጊዜ ጓደኝነት የራሱ የሆነ ገደብ እንዳለው የምንማርበትን ታሪክ እነሆ፡፡
children.author: John Emongot and Rob Owen

children.title: ጭራቆች ደደቦች ናቸው
children.description: ሙሉና ቤተሰቡ ድርቅ ስለመጣባቸው ምግብ እየፈለጉ ነው፡፡ አንድ ማሳ አግኝተው ባለቤቱ ከምርቱ  እንዲመገቡ ፈቀደላቸው፡፡ ለበሉት ምግብ ግን እጅግ ከፍተኛ ክፍያ መክፈል ይኖርባቸዋል፡፡
children.author: Fabian Wakholi and Natalie Propa

children.title: እንስሳቱ እግር ተሰጣቸው
children.description: ሁሉም እንስሳት እንደሰዎች ሁሉ በእግራቸው በመሄድ እንዲደሰቱ ማስረሻ እግር ሊሰጣቸው ወሰነ፡፡
children.author: Mutugi Kamundi and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: ተወዳጇ ልጅ
children.description: ናታቦ የምትወደው ገምቦ ስለተሰበረባት በጣም ተበሳጭታ ወደ ጫካ እየሮጠች ሄዳ ጠፋች፡፡
children.author: Ritah Katetemera, Mulongo Bukheye, and Brian Wambi

children.title: 7 የቀስተደመና ቀለሞች
children.description: ይህ ተረት ቁጥሮችንና ቀለሞችን ለልጆች ያስተዋውቃል፡፡ (ተረቱን በሁለተኛ ደረጃ በተመደቡ ተረቶች ዝርዝር ውስጥም ማግኘት ይችላሉ፡፡)
children.author: Caren Echesa and Jesse Breytenbach

children.title: አያቴ፣ ጥንቸልና ዝሆን
children.description: አንድ ልጅ አያቱ ማታ ማታ ከመተኛቱ በፊት ተረት ታወራለት ነበር፡፡ ከነገረችው ተረቶች አንዱ ይህ ነበር፡፡
children.author: Mutai Chepkoech and Marleen Visser

children.title: ብልኋ ሴት
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2008 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.author: Marion Drew and Marion Drew

children.title: ሦስቱ ጓደኛሞች
children.description: ጓደኝነት  የሚጠናከረው  በአንድነትና  በመተሳሰብ  ነው፡፡  ቡችላ፣ ውርዬና ጫጩት የቤት እንስሳት ናቸው፡፡
children.author: Mary  Jafar, Negassa  Ejeta, and Mekasha Haile

children.title: አስገራሚው ጉንዳን
children.description: የጉንዳንን ዐሰደናቂ ተፈጥሮ ይገልጻል፡፡ ጉንዳን ሰውን/ትልልቅ አውሬዎችና እንስሳትን እንዲሁም አዋፋትን ያጠቃል(አንበሳንና ወተደርን ጨምሮ)
children.author: Nema Behutiye and Mekasha Haile

children.title: ቀይዋ ኳሴ
children.description: ትልቅ ቀይ ኳስ መንገድ ሄዳለች፡፡
children.author: Marion Drew and Marion Drew

children.title: ተመለሽ ድመቴ
children.description: A sneaky cat gets into trouble before naptime.
children.author: Nicola Rijsdijk and Karen Lilje

children.title: የባባ ውሻ
children.description: ልጆች ለቤት እንሰሳት በተለይ ለውሻ ያላቸውን ፍቅር የሚያሳይ ስራ ነው፡፡
children.author: Emmaculate Rono, Heslia Schon, Wiehan de Jager, Marleen Visser, Masika Grace and Sara Saunders, Mango Tree, Silva Afonso, Vusi Malindi, and José Jochicala

children.title: የኔ መንደር
children.description: ስለ ኢትዮጰያ አንዲት መንደር የጀማሪዎች መጽሀፍ የተወሰደው ስለ ኡጋንዳ አንዲት መንደር ከሚለው ታሪክ ነው
children.author: Wendy Parry, Wiehan de Jager, Catherine Groenewald, Laura Libertore, Vusi Malindi, and Mario Kart

children.title: ሠላም ፈጣሪው ህፃን
children.description: በአንድ ጥቅጥቅ ባለና ሽፍታ በሚበዛበት ጫካ ዉስጥ አንዲት እናት ልጇን እዛፍ ስር አስቀምጣ ላይ ትወጣለች፡፡ አንድ ሽፍታ ልጁን ዛፍ ስር ያገኘዋል፡፡ ልጁ ምን ይገጥመው ይሆን?
children.author: John Nga'sike and Jacob Kono

children.title: አዲሴ- የእግር ኳስ ኮከቧ
children.description: እግርኳስ ለወንዶች ብቻ ነው ተብላ በአሰልጣኙ የተከለከለችው አዲሴ የምታደርገውን አንብቡ፡፡
children.author: Eden Daniels and Eden Daniels

children.title: ገንፎ
children.description: እማማ ስለሌለች አባባ ለቁርስ የሚሆን ገንፎ እየሠራ ነው፡፡
children.author: Zimbili Dlamini, Hlengiwe Zondi, and Catherine Groenewald

children.title: ብልጣብልጧ ጥንቸል
children.description: ብልጣብልጧ ጥንቸል እንዴት አድርጋ በብልጠት የዝሆንን ማር  እንደበላችበት ይተርካል፡፡
children.author: Dan Kaasha and Abraham Muzee

children.title: ሚሚ ወደ ትምህርት ቤት ሄደች
children.description: ሚሚ በእረፍት ቀንና በትምህርት ቀኗ እንዴት ንፅህናዋን እንደምትጠብቅ የሚያሳይ፡፡
children.author: Augustine Napagi and Vusi Malindi

children.title: ፋንቱና እቅዷ
children.description: ፋንቱና እቅዷ የአንደኛ ክፍል ተማሪ ታሪክ ነው፡፡ ፋንቱ ጥሩ ልጅ ለመሆን ትፈልጋለች፡፡ ለልጆችም ስለዕለታዊ ተግባራቷ ትናገራለች፡፡
children.author: Mary Jaffer

children.title: አካል ጉዳተኝነት ከምንም አያግድም!
children.description: አካልጉዳተኘነት አለመቻል አይደለም፡፡
children.author: Agnes Mabururu and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: ውኃ ፍለጋ
children.description: ይህ መጽሀፍ ቀዝቃዛ ውሀ ስለምትፈልግ እንቁራሪት ነው፡፡
children.author: Augustine Napagi and Hélder de Paz Alexandre

children.title: ዝሆንን ያታለለችው ጥንቸል
children.description: ይህ ተረት ጥንቸልና ዝሆን በጣም ጥሩ ጓደኞች ቢሆኑም ጥንቸል የዝሆንን ቅናት ተጠቅማ እንዴት መጥፎ ተንኮል እንደሰራችበት ይተርካል፡፡
children.author: Agnes Gichaba and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: ማንበብ እወዳለሁ
children.description: ሕጻኑ ማንበብ ይፈልጋል፡፡ ለማን ላንብብ እያለ ሰው በመፈለግ ላይ ነው፡፡
children.author: Letta Machoga and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: ነብርና ሚዳቋ
children.description: ነብርና ሚዳቋ ጓደኛሞች ለመሆን ቃል ይገባባሉ፡፡ ጓደኝነታቸው ግን ከመጀመሪያው ተበላሸ፡፡
children.author: Magabi Enyew Gessesse, Elizabeth Laird, and Isaac Okwir

children.title: የፀጉር ምርጫዎቻችን
children.description: ህፃናት እንደየፍላጎታቸው ሁኔታ የተለያዩ የፀጉር አሰራር ምርጫዎችን ይመርጣሉ፡፡
children.author: Clare Verbeek, Thembani Dladla, Zanele Buthelezi, Bronwen Heath, Catherine Groenewald, and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: አብሮነትን ማዳበር
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: የሃና የጊዜ አጠቃቀም
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: ከጉልበት ይበልጣል ብልሃት
children.description: በአህያና ዝንጀሮ ተመስሎ ከጉልበት ብልሃት እንደሚበልጥ ያስገነዝባል.
children.author: Mary  Jafar, Negassa  Ejeta, and CODE  Ethiopia

children.title: በቅሎዋ ዋርዲት
children.description: ይህ በቅሎ ለምን ልጅ እንደማትወልድ የሚያብራራ ተረት ነው፡፡ (ይህ ተረት በመስፍን ሀብተማርያም ተተረተ፡፡ የእንግሊዝኛው ቅጂ የተጻፈው በኤሊዛቤት ሊያርድ ነው፡፡
children.author: Mesfin Habte-Mariam, Elizabeth Laird, and Marleen Visser

children.title: አዋቂው ሰውዬ
children.description: አዋቂው ሰውዬ እኔ ከታላቆቼ ሁሉ አውቃለሁ የሚል ሰውዬ ታሪክ ነው።
children.author: Cornelius Wekunya and Joshua Waswa

children.title: ውሣኔ
children.description: በአንዲት መንደር የሚኖር አንድ ማህበረሰብ ሕይወቱን የሚቀይር ውሣኔ ያሳልፋል፡፡ እስኪ ስለዚህ ውሣኔያቸው አብረን እናንብብ፡፡
children.author: Ursula Nafula and Vusi Malindi

children.title: አናንሲና ጥበብ
children.description: የሰማይ አምላክ ለሸረሪቱ ለአናንሲ አንድ ገንቦ ሙሉ ጥበብ ሊሰጠው ይወስናል፡፡ ገንቦው ውስጥ ያለውን እውቀት ሁሉ አይቶ በጣም ስለተደሰተ እውቀትን ለራሱ ብቻ ለማድረግ በመፈለግ ዛፍ ላይ ሊደብቀው ፈለገ፡፡ የእድል ነገር ሆኖ ገንቦው ይወድቅና ይሰበራል፡፡
children.author: Ghanaian folktale and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: እውነቱን ተናግሮ የመሸበት ማደር
children.description: በአንበሳና ሌሎች እንስሳትና አዕዋፋት ተመስሎ ኃላፊነት ወስዶ እውነቱን ስለመናገር ያስገነዝባል፡፡
children.author: CODE  Ethiopia, Nema Behutiye, and Mekasha Haile

children.title: አስካለ
children.description: አንዲት አሮጊት ሴትዮ ካሁን በፊት ኖራት የማታውቅ ልጅ አገኘች፡፡ ወዲያውኑ ግን አጣቻት፡፡ ከዚያ በኋላ ምን እንደሚከሰት ያንብቡና ይድረሱበት፡፡
children.author: Alice Kariuki, Catherine Groenewald, and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: የአባት ውርስ
children.description: ስለ አባት ጥበብ፣ ስለ ልጅ ጉብዝና እና ስለ እርሻ ዋጋ የሚተርት ተረት፡፡ (ይህ ተረት በለሙ ዋቺሌ በኦሮምኛ ተተረተ፡፡ የእንግሊዝኛ ቅጂውን ኤልሳቤጥ ሊያርድ ጻፉት፡፡
children.author: Lemu Wachile, Elizabeth Laird, and Jacob Kono

children.title: ታዳጊው አበራ
children.description: አበራ ወላጅ አልባ ልጅ ነው። አንድ ቀን የአሳዳጊውን ከብቶች በመጠበቅ ላይ እያለ ሃይለኛ ዝናብ ዘነበ። ከዝናቡም ተጠልሎ ሲመለስ ከብቶቹ ጠፍተዋል። እነሱን ፍለጋ ሄደ፥ያገኛቸው ይሆን？
children.author: Gaspah Emukuru Juma and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: እረኛውና የልብ ጓደኛው
children.description: አንድ ዉሻ እረኛ ጓደኛውን ከአደጋ ያድነዋል፡፡ ምን ዓይነት አደጋ ይሆን ያጋጠመው? እስኪ አንብበን እንረዳ፡፡
children.author: Biniam  Asfaw and Isaac Okwir

children.title: ገብጋባው ክንዴ
children.description: ይህ ተረት የአንድ ሁለት ድግሶችን በአንድ ቀን ለመብላት አስቦ የተነሳ ክንዴ የሚባል ሰው ታሪክ ነው፡፡ ይሳካት ይሆን? እስኪ ተረቱን አንብበን እንረዳ!
children.author: Mutugi Kamundi and Zablon Alex Nguku

children.title: ነብርና አይጥ
children.description: ነብርና አይጥ በአንድ ወቅት ጓደኛሞች ነበሩ፡፡ (ይህ ተረት በአብዱልቃድር ጉራቻ ተተረተ፡፡ የእንግሊዝኛውን ቅጂ የጻፉት ኤልሳቤጥ ሊያርድ ናቸው፡፡
children.author: Abdulkadir Guracha, Elizabeth Laird, and Rob Owen

children.title: ቀበሮና ጥንቸል
children.description: ጥንቸል ቀበሮን ከአደጋ አዳነችው፡፡ ነገር ግን ዉለታ ቢሱ ቀበሮ ጥንቸልን ለመሸለም የገባውን ቃል ከመፈጸም ይልቅ ሀሳቡን ቀይሮ ሊበላት ወሰነ፣ ግን በመጨረሻ ራሱ አደጋ ውስጥ ገባ፡፡
children.author: Mohammed Kuyu, Elizabeth Laird, and Jacob Kono

children.title: የዲያብሎስ የአንገት ልብስ
children.description: ሁለት ባለትዳሮች ልጅ መውለድ አቃታቸው፡፡ ሚስትዮዋ ለዲያብሎስ ‹‹ልጅ ከሰጠኸኝ ልዩ ስጦታ እሰጥሃለሁ›› ብላ ተሳለች፡፡
children.author: Azeb Worku Sibane and Jacob Kono

children.title: የአይጢት ቤት
children.description: Mouse tries out various places until he finds a comfortable spot to sleep.
children.author: Michele Fry and Amy Uzzell

children.title: ፋናና እንስሶቿ
children.description: ፋና እንስሳትን ትወዳለች፡፡ እነርሱንም በመመገብና አብራቸው በመጫወት ጊዜዋን ታሳልፋለች፡፡
children.author: Foziya Mohammed and Jesse Breytenbach

children.title: ጥንቸልና ጅብ
children.description: በድሮ ዘመን አንዲት ጥንቸልና አንድ ጅብ በአንድ ላይ ይኖሩ ነበር፡፡ ጥንቸል በጣም ጎበዝ ነበረች፡፡ ሁሌም ከሰነፉ ጅብ በተሻለ ብዙ ምግብ የምታከማቸው ጥንቸል ነበረች፡፡ ጅቡ ስራ ላይ በጣም ሰነፉ ቢሆንም ምግብ መብላት ግን በጣም ይወድ ነበር፡፡ ምን ይፈጠር ይሆን?
children.author: Dennis Mulwa, Wiehan de Jager, and Rob Owen

children.title: በቅሎዋ ዋርዲት
children.description: ይህ በቅሎ ለምን ልጅ እንደማትወልድ የሚያብራራ ተረት ነው፡፡ (ይህ ተረት በመስፍን ሀብተማርያም ተተረተ፡፡ የእንግሊዝኛው ቅጂ የተጻፈው በኤሊዛቤት ሊያርድ ነው፡፡
children.author: Mesfin Habte-Mariam, Elizabeth Laird, and Marleen Visser

children.title: ጴጥሮስና ውሻው
children.description: ይህ የምናነበው ተረት በአንድ ልጅና በውሻው መካከል ስላለ አዲስ ጓደኝነት የሚያትት ጣፋጭ ተረት ነው፡፡
children.author: Bethelihem Waltenegus and Brian Wambi

children.title: ክንፍ ያበቀለው ልጅ
children.description: አንድ ልጅ የወንድሙን ዶሮ በልቶ ክንፍ ማብቀል ጀመረ፡፡ (ይህ ተረት በመጀመሪያ በወርቁ ደበሌ ተተረተ፡፡ የእንግሊዝኛው ቅጂ የተጻፈው በኤልሳቤት ሊያርድ ነው፡፡)
children.author: Worku Debele, Elizabeth Laird, and Tadesse Teshome

children.title: አቤልና የእህቱ አሻንጉሊት
children.description: ስለ አንድ ወንድምና እህት የሚተርከው ይህ ታሪክ ስለ መጥፎ ጸባይም ይናገራል፡፡ ይሁን እንጂ ጥሩ ፍጻሜ አለው፡፡ (ይህን ልብወለድ የጻፈችልን ወጣቷ ደራሲ ዛሬ በሕይወት የለችም፡፡ በፍቅር አናስታውሳታለን፡፡ )
children.author: Eyobi Kitaw and Jesse Breytenbach

children.title: ስፖርት
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: የመገናኛ ብዙሃን አባላት ተሳትፎ
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: ጉብኝት
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: “የአለኸኝ ማስታወሻ”
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: የስራ ክፍፍል
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: መሬምና ውቢት
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: መዝናኛ
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: የፆታ እኩልነት
children.description: ይህ አጋዥ የንባብ መጽሐፍ ከዩ.ኤስ.ኤ.አይ.ዲ. (USAID) በተገኘ የገንዘብ ድጋፍ በሴቭ ዘ ቺልድረን (Save the Children)፣ በትምህርት ሚኒስቴር እና በአማራ ብሄራዊ ክልላዊ መንግሥት ትምህርት ቢሮ የጋራ ትብብር ተዘጋጅቶ ታተመ። 2009 ዓ.ም.
children.author: USAID and Save The Children

children.title: ምክር ያስፈታል ከእሥር
children.description: በአንድ ወቅት በሠፈራችን አንዲት ቆቅ ከልጇ ጋር ትኖር ነበር:: ከዕለታት አንድ ቀን የቆቅ ልጅ የስንዴ ሰብል አሽቶ ታያለች::
children.author: CODE  Ethiopia, Nema Behutiye, and Mekasha Haile

children.title: ቅናት ዋጋ ያስከፍላል
children.description: ስለ አንድ የዋህና ሌላ ቅናተኛ ሴት አውስቶ የቅናት ዉጤት ያስገነዝባል፡፡
children.author: CODE  Ethiopia, Nema Behutiye, and Mekasha Haile

children.title: ኖዚቤሌና ሦስቱ ጸጉሮች
children.description: ሦስት ልጃገረዶች በአንድ ሞቃት ቀን እንጨት እየሰበሩ ነው፡፡ ዋና ለመዋኘት ወደ ወንዝ ወርደው ዋኝተው ሲጨርሱ መሸባቸው፡፡ ወደ ቤታቸውም መሮጥ ግድ ሆነባቸው፡፡ መንገድም ላይ ኖዚቤሌ ዶቃዋን እንደረሳችው አስታወሰች፡፡ ብቻዋንም ወደ ወንዙ ተመለሰች፡፡ከዚያች ደቂቃም በኋላ ጉዞዋ ያልተጠበቀ አቅጣጫ ይይዛል፡፡
children.author: Tessa Welch and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: የአይጦች ንጉሥ ልጅ
children.description: የዓለም ታላቁ ንጉሥ ለልጁ የምትስማማ ሚስት እንዴት ነው የሚመርጠው? (ይህ ተረት መጀመሪያ የተተረተው በመርጋ ደበሎ ሲሆን የእንግሊዝኛውን ቅጂ የጻፉት ደግሞ ኤሊዛቤት ሊያርድ ናቸው፡፡)
children.author: Merga Debelo, Elizabeth Laird, and Salim Kasamba

children.title: አባቱን የታደገው ጥላሁን
children.description: ጥላሁን የሚባል ልጅ የሰከሩ አባቱን እንዴት ከጅብ እንደታደገ የሚነግር ታሪክ።
children.author: Kanyiva Sandi and Benjamin Mitchley

children.title: በሬ እና አህያ
children.description: ታሪኩ ስለአንድ ጠንካራ ሠራተኛ በሬ እና አንድ ብልህ አህያ ነው፡፡
children.author: Melese Getahun Wolde, Elizabeth Laird, and Salim Kasamba

children.title: አማትዮዋ
children.description: ይህ በአንዲት እናትና በምራታቸው መካከል ያለ ረጅም ጊዜ የወሰደ ተረት ነው፡፡ ተረቱ የተተረተው በአብዮት ለገሰ ሲሆን የተረቱን የእንግሊዝኛ ቅጂ ያዘጋጁት ደግሞ ኤልሳቤጥ ሊያርድ ናቸው፡፡

children.title: ট্যাপ সাহেব

children.author: Prabha Bhattarai and Ujwal Tamang

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর এবং পোকা
children.description: বিড়াল ও কুকুর একট চিহ্ন দেখতে পায়। অর্থহীন চিহ্ন; এটি অনবরত হরফ পরিবর্তন করে! তখন, অপ্রত্যাশিত কিছু ঘটে।
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: সাতদিনের ছুটি
children.description: সাতদিনের ছুটির সকল মজাদার কাজকর্ম পড়ো এবং উপভোগ করো।
children.author: Harihar Timilsina and Surendra Maharjan

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর: আঁকো এবং রঙ করো
children.description: বিড়াল ও কুকুরের জন্য এখন আঁকার সময়। তারা কী আঁকবে? তুমি কী আঁকা শিখবে?
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর: কুকুরের শীত লাগে
children.description: কুকুর বেশ শীত লাগে! ভাগ্যিস, বিড়ালের অনেক অতিরিক্ত জামাকাপড় আছে যা কুকুর পড়ে দেখতে পারে।
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: বেলু্ন ফোলানো
children.description: শানু এবং তার বন্ধুরা বেলুন ফুলালো এবং তা ফেটে গেলো। তোমার কি মনে হয় কি ঘটলো যখন শেষ বেলুনটি ফেটে গেলো?
children.author: Sudha Ojha and Shanta Hitang

children.title: বিট্টুর রঙিন বল
children.description: বিট্টু তার রঙিন বল হারিয়ে ফেলেছে। পশুপাখিরা কি বিট্টুকে সেই বল খুঁজে পেতে সাহায্য করতে পারে?
children.author: Venisha Udas and Sonam Tamang

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর এবং প্রজাপতি
children.description: বিড়াল ও কুকুর একটি রঙিন প্রজাপতি ধরতে চায়। কিন্তু প্রজাপতিটি দ্রুত উড়ে যায়।
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর এবং বৃষ্টি
children.description: বিড়াল ও কুকুর বৃষ্টিতে আটকে পড়েছে। তাদের পিঠের ব্যাগগুলো কি ভিজে যাবে নাকি ঠিক সময়মতো কোনো বন্ধু ছাতা নিয়ে হাজির হবে?
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর: হলুদ বিড়াল
children.description: কুকুরের দরজায় হলুদ প্রাণিটি কে? এটা যে বিড়াল — কিন্তু বিড়ালটি হলুদ কেন?
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর এবং বল
children.description: বিড়াল ও কুকুর বল নিয়ে খেলে। তখনই একটা ভুল হয়ে যায়। ভাগ্যিস, হাতি নিকটেই ছিলো এবং সে সাহায্য করতে এগিয়ে আসে!
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: আমার বাজারে যাওয়া
children.description: বাজারে কতোকিছু দেখার ও করার আছে। তুমি বাজারে কী কী দেখতে পাও?
children.author: Deepa Dixit and Diwakar Chhetri

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর এবং ডিম
children.description: বিড়াল ও কুকুর একটি রহস্যময় ডিম দেখতে পায়। এটি কার হতে পারে? খুঁজে দেখতে বিড়াল ও কুকুর অভিযানে বের হয়।
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: চলো ঘুড়ি উড়াই!
children.description: জীবন ঘুড়ি ওড়াতে চায়, কিন্তু সে জানে না কিভাবে তা করতে হয়। জেনে নাও জীবন ও তার বোন রমিলার ঘুড়ি ওড়ানোর জন্য কীকী জানা দরকার।
children.author: Rochak Dahal and Shanta Hitang

children.title: লাল ঘুড়ি
children.description: একটি ঘুড়ি গাছে আঁটকে যায়। দেখো তো পাখিরা তাদের গাছে আসা সেই অদ্ভুত বস্তুটিকে দেখে কে কী বলে।
children.author: Harihar Timilsina and Diwakar Chetri

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর এবং টুপি
children.description: বিড়াল ও কুকুরের আনকোরা নতুন টুপি আছে! কিন্তু তাদের টুপিগুলো বাতাসে উড়ে হ্রদে গিয়ে পড়ার পর তারা কী করে? আমরা আশা করতে পারি, তাদের কোনো তৃষ্ণার্ত বন্ধু আশেপাশেই আছে।
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর: বিড়াল কোথায়?
children.description: কুকুর বিড়ালকে কোথাও খুঁজে পাচ্ছে না। আরে, দেখো, গাছে ওটা কী?
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: বিড়াল ও কুকুর এবং আলু
children.description: বিড়াল ও কুকুর ক্ষুধার্ত। কিন্তু তাদের সুস্বাদু আলু পালিয়ে বেড়ালে তারা কিভাবে খাবে?
children.author: Elke and René Leisink and René & Elke Leisink

children.title: জাদু প্রদর্শনী
children.description: বাবু তার বাবার সঙ্গে জাদু প্রদর্শনীতে যাচ্ছে, সেজন্য সে বেশ উত্তেজিত। বাবু কোন জাদুটি বেশি পছন্দ করবে?
children.author: Prabha Bhattarai and Ujwal Tamang

children.title: গোণো এবং বলো
children.description: রঙিণ প্রাণি ও বস্তু দশ পর্যন্ত গুণে মজা করো। আর কোন জিনিস তোমাকে দশ পর্যন্ত গুণতে সাহায্য করতে পারে?
children.author: Deepa Dixit and Surendra Maharjan

children.title: আমি আজ কিভাবে কেশবিন্যাস করবো?
children.description: অনেক হেয়ার স্টাইল আছে। হেয়ার স্টাইল পরিবর্তন করলে তোমাকে কার মতো দেখাবে?
children.author: Sudha Ojha and Mrigaja Bajracharya

children.title: আবদুল কালাম, আমার শিক্ষকের জন্য একটি শিক্ষা
children.description: একজন তরুণ তার শিক্ষককে নিয়ে ঝামেলায় আছে, কিন্তু এখানে তার শিক্ষকই শিক্ষা নেয়।
children.author: A.P.J. Abdul Kalam, Arun Tiwari, and Deepta Nangia

children.title: চিড়িয়াখানায় ক্রিকেট খেলা
children.description: আর্ভি ক্রিকেট খেলা পছন্দ করে। সম্প্রতি সে এমন কয়েকজনের দেখা পেয়েছে যারা তার চাইতে ঢের বেশি ক্রিকেট পছন্দ করে! জেনে নাও এই মজার ক্রিকেট বিশ্বকাপের গল্প।
children.author: BookBox and Kathiravan

children.title: রাজার গোপন বিষয়
children.description: রাজার একটি গোপন বিদ্যা আছে যা কেউ জানে না। এটি কী হতে পারে?
children.author: Kuzhali Manickavel and Emanuele Scanziani

children.title: বিশাল মেগাফোন
children.description: প্রতিরাতে একটি দানব পাখি খাবারের জন্য পোকা ধরতে আসে। পোকারা খুব ভয় পায়। একটি চালাম মেয়ে ঝিঁঝিঁপোকার মাথায় একটি বুদ্ধি আসে। কিন্তু তাকে অন্যদের বুঝিয়ে পরিকল্পনা বাস্তবায়নে একত্র করতে হবে।
children.author: Mut Somaly and Ung Keamesa

children.title: সূর্যের সন্ধানে
children.description: শ্রে পভদের গ্রামে আর সূর্য উঠছে না। শ্রে পভ সূর্যের কাছে গিয়ে এর কারণ জানতে চায়। জেনে নাও এই মজার অভিযানে সে কী কী দেখতে পায়।
children.author: Svay Leemeng and Meas Sovannara

children.title: কৃষক রাজকন্যা
children.description: একজন রাজকন্যা কি কখনো কৃষক হতে পারে? নিজেই খুঁজে দেখো।
children.author: Kuzhali Manickavel and Emanuele Scanziani

children.title: বাতাস ও সূর্য
children.description: কে বেশি শক্তিশালী: গনগনে সূর্য নাকি অহংকারী বাতাস?
children.author: Kuzhali Manickavel and Emanuele Scanziani

children.title: চার বন্ধু
children.description: চার বন্ধু: হরিণ, কচ্ছপ, কাক ও ইঁদুর। তারা শিকারীর ফাঁদ নিয়ে চিন্তিত। তারা কি শিকারীর বুদ্ধিতে হারিয়ে একে অপরকে রক্ষা করতে পারবে?
children.author: Adapted by BookBox and Emanuele Scanziani

children.title: ডাগরচোখা মৌমাছি
children.description: সোফি খুব চটপটে এক মৌমাছি। সে দ্রুত উড়ে মধু সংগ্রহ করে, কিন্তু সে অন্য মৌমাছিদের সঙ্গে চলাফেরা করে না। একদিন সোফি তার দল থেকে বিচ্ছিন্ন হয়ে গাছের মগডালে একটি রহস্যময় বেগুনি ফুলের খুঁজতে যায় এবং বিপদে পড়ে। যখন একটি জোনাকি ও তার দলের মৌমাছিরা তাকে উদ্ধার করে, তখন সে বুঝতে পারে বন্ধুত্বের গুরুত্ব।
children.author: Iem Tithseiha and Sou Kimsan

children.title: বালিতে বার্তা
children.description: একটি ছোট বালক সমুদ্র ভালোবাসে। মাছ ও গাছপালা মরে যাচ্ছে দেখে তার মন খারাপ। এদের বাঁচানোর জন্য সে কী করতে পারে?
children.author: Charmaine Aserappa and Roel Obemio

children.title: সবুজ তারা
children.description: নিতা বিজ্ঞান ভালোবাসে। একদিন, সে তার বাড়ির পিছনে পাহাড়ে একটি ধরাম শব্দ শুনতে পায় এবং একটি ‘সবুজ’ বালককে দেখতে পায়। নিতা কিভাবে তার বিজ্ঞানের জ্ঞান কাজে লাগিয়ে ‘সবুজ’ বালককে তার নিজের দেশে ফিরে যেতে সাহায্য করতে পারে?
children.author: Prum Kunthearo and Chan Pisey

children.title: গল্পবইয়ের রাজকন্যা
children.description: চমনান গল্প শুনতে পছন্দ করে। কিন্তু সে প্রচুর প্রশ্ন করে। কিছু কিছু প্রশ্নের উত্তর দেওয়া তার পিতার জন্য কঠিন হয়ে দাঁড়ায়। এক রাতে সে তার গল্পের বইয়ের এক চরিত্রকে স্বপ্নে দেখে। এক রাজকন্যা ডাইনির জাদুমন্ত্রে প্রভাবিত। সকালে সে উত্তেজিত হয়ে তার পিতাকে বইয়ের সেই রাজকন্যার গল্প বলতে বলে।
children.author: Prum Kunthearo and Seng Visoth

children.title: ভাসমান বাগান
children.description: কঙ্কিয়া তার বাবা ও ভাইয়ের সঙ্গে একটি ভাসমান গ্রামের বাস করে। সে তাদের সঙ্গে মাছ ধরতে যেতে চায়, কিন্তু কিন্তু তাকে বাড়িতে থেকে একটি ভাসমান বাগান দেখাশোনা করতে বলা হয়। একদিন, বাগানটি রহস্যজনকভাবে ভাসতে ভাসতে বাড়ি থেকে দূরে চলে যায়। কঙ্কিয়া ঠিক করে, সে প্রথমবারের মতো নৌকা নিয়ে বাগানের সন্ধানে বেরুবে।
children.author: Iem Tithseiha and Nan Sang

children.title: প্রথম কূপ
children.description: এক যোদ্ধা রাজ্যকে খরা থেকে বাঁচানোর জন্য পানির খোঁজে বের হয়। সে ‘পানির বীজ’ নিয়ে বাড়ি ফেরে। পানির বীজ থেকে কি পানি বেরুবে?
children.author: Adapted by BookBox and Emanuele Scanziani

children.title: বিস্ময়কর অভিযান
children.description: টিটো ও রিকা মোবাইল ফোন ঝগড়া করে। হঠাৎ করে একটি বাটনে চাপ পড়তেই এক ইউএফও এসে হাজির ঘরের দরজায়। এক এলিয়েন তাদের ইউএফও-তে ওঠার জন্য ডাক দেয়। একটি কুকুরছানা এবং একটি জোনাকি সঙ্গে নিয়ে মহাকাশযানে চড়ে তারা এক অসাধারণ অভিযানে বের হয়। কিন্তু পরদিন সকালে উঠে তারা অবাক... তবে এটা কি শুধুই স্বপ্ন ছিল?
children.author: Kim Ann Arun and Seat Sopheap

children.title: প্রাচ ও সাথী
children.description: ষষ্ঠ গ্রেডের এক ছাত্র সাথী। সে চতুর্থ গ্রেডের এক ছাত্রী প্রাচের সঙ্গে চাপাবাজি করছে। প্রাচ কাউকে সাহায্যের জন্য ডাকতে চায়, কিন্তু তার ভয় এতে সাথী আরো কঠোর আচরণ করবে। একদিন, প্রাচের অন্তরঙ্গ বন্ধু ভেটি চাপাবাজির ব্যাপারটা লক্ষ করে এবং তার শিক্ষককে জানায়। বালকেরা এই দ্বন্দ্বের সমাধান করে। এবং এটা করতে গিয়ে তারা বিস্ময়কর অন্তর্দৃষ্টি লাভ করে।
children.author: Huot Sarith and Ouk Ratha

children.title: আং বাটাং মারামিং বাওয়াল
children.description: এটি এক বালকের গল্প যে কীনা ফিলিপাইনের আকাশে উড়ে উড়ে দেশটির সৌন্দর্য অবলোকনের কল্পনা করে ও স্বপ্ন দেখে।
children.author: Fernando Rosal Gonzalez and Rodel Tapaya

children.title: Cow With One Horn
children.description: Have you ever seen a cow with only one horn and no tail?
children.author: Sebongile Daniel, Mpho Ntlhanngoe, Khothatso Ranoosi, and Marion Drew

children.title: What Type Of Teeth?
children.description: Some animals have sharp teeth for biting. Other animals have flat teeth for grinding. Some animals don't have any teeth. What about you?
children.author: Clare Verbeek, Thembani Dladla, Zanele Buthelezi, and Rob Owen

children.title: Chicken And Millipede
children.description: Chicken and Millipede have a very competitive friendship. One day Chicken becomes so angry for losing that she does something very silly.
children.author: Winny Asara and Magriet Brink

children.title: What Are You Doing?
children.description: Short sentences using simple present tense verbs.
children.author: Nina Orange and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: Friends
children.description: A story about a boy and his friends,  and the activities they like to do.
children.author: Zimbili Dlamini, Hlengiwe Zondi, and Catherine Groenewald

children.title: I Like To Read
children.description: This is a story about a little boy who loves to read stories. He loves it so much that he wants to share a story with his family.
children.author: Letta Machoga and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: My Red Ball
children.description: A big red ball goes on a journey.
children.author: Marion Drew and Marion Drew

children.title: My Teacher
children.description: This little girl loves her teacher,  and wants to be just like her.
children.author: Hlengiwe Zondi, Zimbili Dlamini, and Jesse Pietersen

children.title: Pendo Our Cow
children.description: A story about a much loved family cow.
children.author: Ruth Odondi and Rob Owen

children.title: Porridge
children.description: Mom is away and Dad is making the morning porridge.
children.author: Zimbili Dlamini, Hlengiwe Zondi, and Catherine Groenewald

children.title: Musau And His Father
children.description: Musau's father got drunk every night. One night,  he was attacked by a hyena. Would anyone still help him after playing tricks on them all the time?
children.author: Kanyiva Sandi and Benjamin Mitchley

children.title: Donkey And Ox
children.description: A story about a hard-working ox and a clever donkey.
children.author: Melese Getahun Wolde, Elizabeth Laird, and Salim Kasamba

children.title: Cheep Cheep Drip Drip
children.description: The baby in this book hears so many interesting sounds around her. Can you hear them too?
children.author: Lubaina Bandukwala and Zainab Tambawalla

children.title: My Home
children.description: Welcome to my Home!
children.author: Rukmini Banerji, Rajeev Verma 'Banjara', and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: Colours of Nature
children.description: An eminent artist plays with the colours of nature. A lovely offering for early readers.
children.author: Pratham books authors

children.title: I Am Not Afraid!
children.description: A little girl goes out alone in the dark. What does she find? This book is one of the four books in the 'Growing Up' series.
children.author: Mini Shrinivasan and Rayika Sen

children.title: My Best Friend
children.description: Would you like to have a very special friend? Look into this book and you may find that you already have a very special friend!
children.author: Anupa Lal and Suvidha Mistry

children.title: Curly and Straight
children.description: Do you like curly tails or straight tails? There are some things we like whether straight or curly!
children.author: Radha HS and Ruchi Shah

children.title: Playtime
children.description: Golu and Chhotu sure make a funny pair. Read about their antics in this funny story.
children.author: Sanjiv Jaiswal 'Sanjay', Ajit Narayan, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: A Street or a Zoo?
children.description: Sonu, Monu and Rina discovered many things together in 'Colours on the Street'. In this second book, the three friends set out to play. Little did they know that they would meet so many animals. Would you like to meet them too?
children.author: Pratham books authors

children.title: What If?
children.description: When Shyam is sleepy he has trouble brushing his teeth. But dreaming big is no trouble at all.
children.author: Hari Kumar Nair and Hari Kumar Nair

children.title: I Can Help!
children.description: A big girl or boy can help others in many ways. Helping is so much fun! This book is one of the four books in the 'Growing Up' series.
children.author: Mini Shrinivasan and Aman Randhawa

children.title: Bath time for Chunnu and Munnu
children.description: Join Chunnu and Munnu as they splash about while having a bath. A fun read-aloud and a great way to say goodnight.
children.author: Rohini Nilekani, Sonal Goyal, Sumit Sakhuja, and Rohini Nilekani

children.title: Little Painters
children.description: Painting the house is such fun! But what colour should the gate be?
children.author: Pratham books authors

children.title: "My fish!" "No, my fish!"
children.description: A funny little story about three friends and three clever fish!
children.author: Suraj J Menon and Soumya Menon

children.title: Busy ants
children.description: Follow the ants in this book. They are sure to keep young readers busy. This book is one of the four books in the 'Animals Around Us' series.
children.author: Kanchan Bannerjee and Deepa Balsavar

children.title: I Want That One!
children.description: "Not that one," says Anil's mother when he asks for something. "Not that one!" say all the shopkeepers in the market too. That makes the little boy very angry indeed!
children.author: Mala  Kumar and Soumya Menon

children.title: Smile Please!
children.description: Follow the young deer as he races along with friends.
children.author: Sanjiv Jaiswal 'Sanjay', Ajit Narayan, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: I Can Climb!
children.description: Here, a little boy learns to climb up. But can he climb down? This book is one of the four books in the 'Growing Up' series.
children.author: Mini Shrinivasan and Deval Maniar

children.title: The Birthday Party
children.description: After his birthday party, the boy in the story opens his gifts and is thrilled to find a camera. But as he's playing with his new gift, he notices his mother crying in the kitchen. Find out what he does next!
children.author: Storyweaver, Pratham Books and Megha Vishwanath

children.title: Out in the Garden
children.description: A man is out in his garden, digging and sowing, when it starts to rain and strange things happen... like fish falling from the sky!
children.author: Storyweaver, Pratham Books and Sonal Gupta

children.title: I Can Make Things!
children.description: There are many nice things that children can make on their own. What are they? This book is one of the four books in the 'Growing Up' series.
children.author: Mini Shrinivasan and Tanvee Nabar

children.title: The Royal Toothache
children.description: Even the king of the jungle must keep his teeth clean. Read this sweet story about who taught him this important lesson.
children.author: Sanjiv Jaiswal 'Sanjay', Ajit Narayan, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: Fat King Thin Dog
children.description: Run along with the Fat King after the Thin Dog!
children.author: Parismita

children.title: Aaloo-Maaloo-Kaaloo
children.description: One day Maloo had to get some potates from his grandmother's kitchen garden, but he could not find any. And then Kaloo helps him to uncover the hidden potatoes.
children.author: Vinita Krishna, Suvidha Mistry, and Ritu Singh

children.title: Curious Baby Elephant
children.description: Elephants once had short noses,  but thanks to a curious baby elephant,  they ended up with useful long trunks.
children.author: African Storybook Initiative authors

children.title: Colour-In Goat, Dog And Cow
children.description: Colour-in version. Goat,  Dog and Cow are good friends. They take a trip together on a taxi,  but when the time comes to pay the driver one of the friends does something surprising.
children.author: Fabian Wakholi and Marleen Visser

children.title: Namu's Bicycle
children.description: A monkey rides away with Namu’s bicycle!
children.author: Munanga ASb teachers and Salim Kasamba

children.title: Happy Akai
children.description: A girl gets shoes for the first time.
children.author: Ursula Nafula and Rob Owen

children.title: How Ant Saved Dove
children.description: The land is dry and Little Ant is very thirsty. He goes to the river for a drink and is swept away.
children.author: Judith Baker, Kholeka Mabeta, and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: Too Small
children.description: Lebo has grown out of all her clothes and they are now too small for her. What will she do with them?
children.author: Media Matters and Sandy Lightly

children.title: Teacher Akinyi
children.description: A short and simple story about a wonderful teacher and what she teaches us.
children.author: Lawrence A. Konjuro and Vusi Malindi

children.title: Disability Is Not Inability
children.description: This short story celebrates the abilities of people with disabilities.
children.author: Agnes Mabururu and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: Child As a Peacemaker
children.description: In a wild part of Turkana,  a woman leaves her baby under a tree as she climbs in search of fruit. A stranger sees the baby alone. What happens to the baby?
children.author: John Nga'sike and Jacob Kono

children.title: Punishment
children.description: What is the punishment for a greedy boy who ate too much fruit?
children.author: Adelheid Marie Bwire and Melany Pietersen

children.title: Rooster and Hare
children.description: Be careful about what might happen when you play a joke on someone.
children.author: Geoffrey Thiiru and Duane Arthur

children.title: Children of Wax
children.description: Once there was a family with three very obedient children. The problem was that they were made of wax.
children.author: Southern African Folktale and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: The Red Raincoat
children.description: Manu has a new raincoat. He can't wait to wear it, but the rain makes him wait... and wait... and wait.
children.author: Kiran Kasturia and Zainab Tambawalla

children.title: Annual Haircut Day
children.description: Sringeri Srinivas had very long hair. He wanted it cut on Annual Haircut Day. Everyone was busy. You will never guess who helped him that day! Read and enjoy!
children.author: Rohini Nilekani and Angie & Upesh

children.title: Hot Tea and Warm Rugs
children.description: Meenu's smart winter uniforms are out and the air is filled with the aroma of roasted nuts. Not to forget a cloud of mist in front of her mouth while she speaks! Let us find out what is happening this winter.
children.author: Mala Kumar, Manisha Chaudhry, and Priya Kuriyan

children.title: Saboo and Jojo
children.description: Jojo and Saboo make a lovely pair!
children.author: Herminder Ohri and Herminder Ohri

children.title: Rumniya
children.description: Rumniya and Nani are a cheerful pair because they know most things turn out right in the end. Read this sweet story about resourceful Rumniya!
children.author: Rukmini Banerji and Henu

children.title: The Day It Rained Fish
children.description: Strange things happen at Ballu the bear's birthday party. Follow him and Avanti the zookeeper as they get drenched in a rain of fish.
children.author: Ramendra Kumar and Delwyn Remedios

children.title: Lassi, Ice-cream or Falooda?
children.description: Is mango panna better in taste than lassi or is falooda better than both of these? Well, the only way to find out is to enjoy these and that is what Meenu is doing! What else can you do in summer?
children.author: Mala Kumar, Manisha Chaudhry, and Priya Kuriyan

children.title: What Shall I Wear Today?
children.description: On some days, it is so difficult to decide what to wear. The little girl in this story tries on many dresses before she finds the perfect one.
children.author: Natasha Sharma and Tanvi Choudhury

children.title: Samira Goes Shopping
children.description: Join Samira and Mouchak on their unusual shopping trip!
children.author: Bharati Jagannathan and Preeti Krishnamurthy

children.title: Pehelwaan Ji
children.description: Pehelwaan Ji was a bit of a bully. But Gappu soon took care of that. Read this amusing story about their bout of wrestling!
children.author: Sanjiv Jaiswal 'Sanjay', Ajit Narayan, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: Too Many Bananas
children.description: No one wanted to buy the sweet bananas that Sringeri Srinivas grew on his farm. Find out what he did with them in this cute story.
children.author: Rohini Nilekani and Angie & Upesh

children.title: Serpy, the Snake
children.description: Serpy wants to move in straight lines. But have you ever seen a snake move in a straight line? Serpy looks at the world around him and comes up with a straight answer!
children.author: Rajiv Tambe and Rijuta Ghate

children.title: Pehelwaan ji Plays Cricket
children.description: The children of the village were scared of the big man, Pehelwaan ji. So when he wanted to play with them, they just had to let him play.
children.author: Sanjiv Jaiswal 'Sanjay', Ajit Narayan, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: Rain, Rain
children.description: Roll along with the cloud as it brings rain and joy!
children.author: Sanjiv Jaiswal 'Sanjay', Ajit Narayan, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: Singing in the Rain
children.description: Sukhiya Kaka was a famous singer. He met Dinoo who turned out to be his biggest fan. Together they made quite a pair!
children.author: Mala  Kumar, Manisha Chaudhry, Rajiv Eipe, Mala  Kumar, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: What Does Anu See?
children.description: Anu sees many lovely things around her. Do you see them too?
children.author: Lavanya Karthik and Lavanya Karthik

children.title: Spot and Spike
children.description: Meet Spot and Spike. Spike thinks Spot is boring and ordinary. Little does he know about Spot's clever little plan.
children.author: Natasha Sharma and Archana Sreenivasan

children.title: Pambaram the Naughty Top
children.description: Spin along with Pambaram, the naughty top, which has a mind of its own.
children.author: Kavitha Punniyamurthi and Ajanta Guhathakurta

children.title: Smart Sona Helps Her Mother
children.description: Sona is smarter than ever. You may have read how she helped her father. This time she finds her mother’s work very interesting!
children.author: Vinita Krishna, Suvidha Mistry, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: Going to Buy a Book
children.description: Children always like to share their experience with others. 'Going to Buy a Book' shows how enjoyable these experiences can be. Tag along with these siblings as they pick books in a bookstore.
children.author: Rukmini Banerji and Santosh Pujari

children.title: Avani and the Pea Plant
children.description: Who did it? Avani does not know. Her mother does not know. But you will know who did it when you read this book about a pea plant.
children.author: Shruthi Rao and Debasmita Dasgupta

children.title: The Timid Train
children.description: Loco, the new train felt rather scared of going anywhere. But every time it let out an "Ooo!" in fright, it came out as a strong whistle and everybody said Loco was a fine train. Come take a ride with Loco as it chugs merrily across the country.
children.author: Bharati Jagannathan and Preeti Krishnamurthy

children.title: When Amma Went to School
children.description: Meera's mother went to her school one day but everyone was missing - Meera, her friends, the teachers, even the Principal. Where had they all disappeared?
children.author: Nandini Nayar and Ruchi Shah

children.title: Goodnight Tinku!
children.description: Tinku, a little pup at Mangu's farm is not sleepy at all. He decides to step out into the night and meets many interesting animals.
children.author: Preethi Nambiar, Sonal Goyal, and Sumit Sakhuja

children.title: Going to a Wedding
children.description: Children always like to share their experience with others. Going to a wedding shows how enjoyable the experiences can be.
children.author: Rukmini Banerji and Santosh Pujari

children.title: Where is Gogo?
children.description: When Toto spotted Gogo's empty cage, he knew he was in trouble. Would you like to help Toto find Gogo?
children.author: Mala  Kumar, Manisha Chaudhry, Soumya Menon, Mala  Kumar, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: Too Much Noise
children.description: Sringeri Srinivas, the lovable farmer with very long hair, has to take his cows along the new highway, to the cattle fair. Our farmer finds the noise just too much!
children.author: Rohini Nilekani and Angie & Upesh

children.title: Grandma's Glasses
children.description: Grandma loses her glasses all the time. Sometimes she needs a smart detective to find them for her!
children.author: Rohini Nilekani and Tanaya Vyas

children.title: Paper Play
children.description: Manju finds a piece of paper. And in the hands of her friends, it becomes so much more than just a piece of paper. Illustrated using bits of paper, so that each page is a collage, imagination is at play in this little story.
children.author: Mala Kumar and Ruchi Shah

children.title: Topsy Turvy
children.description: Everything is turning upside down in a little boy’s house. What could be the reason for this?
children.author: Rohini Nilekani, Angie & Upesh, and Rohini Nilekani

children.title: Peacocks and Pakodas!
children.description: From listening to a melodious Kajari to watching tiny waterfalls, and from the lovely scent of moist soil to the smell of Amma's pakodas, Meenu loves every bit of the monsoon.
children.author: Mala Kumar, Manisha Chaudhry, and Priya Kuriyan

children.title: No Smiles Today
children.description: Shanti was a happy girl. No one had seen her sad or quiet. Then one day she went very quiet. What had happened to Shanti?
children.author: Cheryl Rao and Saurabh Pandey

children.title: Thangwang and Bhalluka
children.description: Thangwang the baby, and Bhalluka the bear, loved to talk to each other. Gaaa! Grrrr! Read this to see if you can understand them!
children.author: Mala Kumar and Jithin Jacob

children.title: The Scarecrows on Parade
children.description: Scarecrows are put up in fields to scare away birds and animals. But little Gauri thinks otherwise!
children.author: Shamim Padamsee and Tanaya Vyas

children.title: Kaka and Munni: A Folktale from Punjab
children.description: Kaka, the wicked crow, wants to eat Munni's eggs. But Munni is a very clever sparrow. And so are all the characters in this popular folktale from Punjab.
children.author: Natasha Sharma and Natasha Sharma

children.title: Flying High
children.description: Go along with Chandu as he dreams of flying. What do you dream of?
children.author: Vidya Tiware, Rijuta Ghate, and Rohini Nilekani

children.title: Hatchu! Ha-aaa-tchu!
children.description: There is something that Hatchuram does that makes the whole town go topsy-turvy. Would you like to find out what it is?
children.author: Sharada Kolluru and Lavanya Karthik

children.title: Mr. Anand has an Adventure
children.description: Mr. Anand loves to go walking in new places. Every outing is an adventure to him. This time he thinks he has learnt a new language. Do you also think so?
children.author: Mala Kumar, Manisha Chaudhry, and Satya Krishna Prakash

children.title: My Balwadi
children.description: Children always like to share their experience with others. My Balwadi shows how enjoyable the experiences can be.
children.author: Rukmini Banerji, Sheetal Thapa, and Madhav Chavan

children.title: Aunty Jui's Baby
children.description: Anu and her mother visit Aunty Jui to see her new baby.  Aai and Aunty fuss over her but Anu thinks the baby is really silly.
children.author: Madhuri Purandare and Madhuri Purandare

children.title: Little by Little
children.description: What do two brave little rabbits do when the wolf asks for shelter? Find out in this fun book... little by little.
children.author: Pratham books authors

children.title: Here Comes the Camel and Other Poems
children.description: Prayag Shukla's poems in Hindi have enchanted young and old alike. This collection of poems translated into English brings the joy of his writing to a new set of readers. Siraj Saxena's innovative artwork adds to the appeal of this classic collection.
children.author: Prayag Shukla, Siraj Saxena, and Manisha Chaudhry

children.title: Daddy Mo's
children.description: What does Anu like the most about her dad? His Mo! Do you know what a Mo is? Actually, Anu likes everyone with a Mo. So much so that when she sees a Mo, she gets funny ideas!
children.author: Madhuri Purandare, Madhuri Purandare, and Sai Keskar

children.title: Veeru Goes to the Circus
children.description: Veeru comes back from the Jumbo-Mumbo Circus with some very big ideas. Read on to find out more.
children.author: Richa Ingle Deo and Reshma Barve

children.title: Sringeri Srinivas Learns to Laugh
children.description: Sringeri Srinivas was tearing his hair in anger in Annual Haircut Day. He came up with a great idea in Too Many Bananas. In Too Much Noise, he found peace. In this book, the crazy but lovable, long-haired farmer becomes very, very angry again.
children.author: Rohini Nilekani and Angie & Upesh

children.title: Brushing is No Fun!
children.description: Rohan does not like to brush his teeth or take a bath. But his sister Riya tells him a secret that changes his mind!
children.author: Srividhya Venkat and Anupama Ajinkya Apte

children.title: Sniffles the Crocodile and Punch the Butterfly
children.description: What are friends for, if not to help each other? Even friends like Sniffles, the Crocodile and Punch, the Butterfly. A lovely story about two clever friends.
children.author: Herminder Ohri and Herminder Ohri

children.title: Mouse in the House
children.description: A mouse enters the house. And there is utter chaos. Here is an action-packed adventure for little ones.
children.author: Sowmya Rajendran and Tanaya Vyas

children.title: Namorutunga
children.description: Namoratunga in Turkana,  Kenya,  is an ancient site of 19 stone pillars. This story explains how those stones came to be at the site.
children.author: Simon Ipoo and Zablon Alex Nguku

children.title: Holidays With Grandmother
children.description: Two children are excited as they prepare to visit their grandmother in her village. They enjoy life in the village so much that they don't want to leave.
children.author: Violet Otieno and Catherine Groenewald

children.title: Chicken and Millipede
children.description: Chicken and Millipede have a very competitive friendship. One day Chicken gets so cross about losing that she does something very silly.
children.author: Winny Asara and Magriet Brink

children.title: The Talking Bag
children.description: Three little girls meet a giant who pretends to need help with firewood.
children.author: Caroline Lentupuru and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: No Pigs Allowed
children.description: This tale explains why pigs have flat noses. What else does the story teach us?
children.author: Basilio Gimo, Little Zebra Books, and Laura Libertore

children.title: Keeper And His Special Nursery
children.description: A story about rescued baby animals arriving at a nursery for orphans. These little animals are nursed and looked after by a special person and his team of helpers.
children.author: Ursula Nafula, Nina Orange, and Magriet Brink

children.title: Akai's Special Mat
children.description: This young Turkana girl grows up with a most unusual and remarkable mat.
children.author: Ursula Nafula and Catherine Groenewald

children.title: Why Hippos Have No Hair
children.description: In this Nyungwe folktale,  we see what happens when Hare refuses to forgive Hippo for stepping on his foot.
children.author: Basilio Gimo, David Ker, and Carol Liddiment

children.title: How Do Aeroplanes Fly?
children.description: Sarla wished she could fly high like an eagle or like an aeroplane. Of course you can fly, said her new teacher. Here, Sarla shares all that she has learnt about flight and aeroplanes.
children.author: Aditi Sarawagi and Lavanya Karthik

children.title: Why Do Bees Buzz?
children.description: Why can't bees work quietly? They buzz because there are some very good reasons to do so. Learn about the humble bees in this book.
children.author: Nabanita Deshmukh and Zainab Tambawalla

children.title: Pishi Caught in a Storm
children.description: Pishi was a huge manta ray fish. Once, when he was caught in a big storm in the Indian Ocean, guess who came to his rescue? Dive into this book for a dramatic story.
children.author: Mala Kumar, Manisha Chaudhry, and Sangeeta Das

children.title: Sister Where Does the Sun Go at Night?
children.description: Little Brother's inquisitive mind is always full of questions for Big Sister. He knows Big Sister has all the answers, because she is always reading one big fat book or another. In this book, Little Brother wonders where the sun goes at night. Does he just go to sleep after a long day at work, or does he sink down into the ocean deep to make it daylight for the mermaids who frolic there?
children.author: Roopa Pai and Greystroke

children.title: The Sparrow and The Fruit
children.description: When her plump juicy guava falls into a clump of thorns, Gubbi uses every trick she knows, and gets the fruit back. But is it right to use mean tricks to get what you want? Find out by reading this book!
children.author: Venkatramana Gowda, Padmanabh, and Divaspathy Hegde

children.title: Bhabhloo Bear's Adventure
children.description: Bhabhloo Bear’s life is full of twists and turns and he moves forward with leaps and bounds… literally! Join him on his thrilling nocturnal adventure and find out many secrets about Himalayan bears.
children.author: Paro Anand and Suvidha Mistry

children.title: Paplu the giant
children.description: Paplu was a strange giant who did not like to fight with anyone, nor did he like scaring people. But when his beloved villagers were in danger, he rose to great heights to solve the problem.
children.author: Ramendra Kumar and Zainab Tambawalla

children.title: Where Did Your Dimples Go?
children.description: Langlen has curly hair like Appa and a cleft chin like Imma. It makes her wonder why brothers and sisters, or parents and children look alike. Is she just a collection of traits, then? So many questions, but Imma and Appa have all the answers.
children.author: Radha HS and Kruttika Susarla

children.title: How Does the Toothpaste Get into the Tube?
children.description: Squeezing out the toothpaste from the tube every morning is simple. But do you know how it got into the tube? Let's tell you how.
children.author: Veena Prasad and Rajiv Eipe

children.title: Up World, down world
children.description: In a canopy forest in India, the Up World and Down World have always been suspicious of each other. But it all changes when Gopa the dormouse drops her book by accident on Fatima’s head. A story about the biodiversity of the canopy forests and friendship.
children.author: Padmaparna Ghosh and Sunaina Coelho

children.title: The Missing Bat
children.description: There was a cricket bat missing from Rehman Chacha's warehouse, and he suspected that young Ahmed had stolen it. A funny tale from Kashmir, the land of the willow trees.
children.author: Vaishali Shroff and Tapas Guha

children.title: The Boy and the Drum
children.description: A folktale about giving and kindness transforms into a lively play! This versatile and adaptable piece can be performed on stage or in the classroom. Hours of fun and learning guaranteed!
children.author: Umesh P N and Rajiv Eipe

children.title: Dum Dum-a-Dum Biryani!
children.description: Basha and Sainabi are in a panic. Ammi is ill, and Saira aunty has just announced that she is arriving for lunch - with 23 other people! Budding chef Basha thinks he can cook Ammi's Dum Biryani, but her recipe only makes enough for 4 people. Math wiz Sainabi jumps in to help, declaring that she knows how to turn a 4-person recipe to a 24-person recipe. Do the siblings succeed in serving up a truly Dum Dum-a-Dum biryani? Read this book to find out!
children.author: Gayathri Tirthapura and Kabini Amin

children.title: Why Does A Poori Puff Up?
children.description: Round, fat pooris are a treat in most Indian homes. Why do they puff? There is a whole lot of science behind this simple question.
children.author: Varsha Joshi and Sonal Gupta

children.title: Inside the World Wide Web
children.description: Know how to send an email? Of COURSE! Then you know what the internet is, don't you? Umm... sort of. And you know what www means, right? Wellll... kind of. You are feeling a little silly right now, aren't you? Mmmm. Never fear, Nettikutti is here! Gather round to listen as our bright little friend unravels the magic and mystery of the ginormous digital brain called the world wide web.
children.author: Roopa Pai and Delwyn Remedios

children.title: The Boy and the Drum (A Shorter Version)
children.description: A folktale about giving and kindness transforms into a lively play! This versatile and adaptable piece can be performed on stage or in the classroom. Hours of fun and learning guaranteed!
children.author: Umesh P N and Rajiv Eipe

children.title: Reeti and Mithu
children.description: Reeti's holidays have begun, but she isn't happy. She doesn't like holidays because she misses being with her friends. One day she gets a pet - Mithu, the talking parrot. Does Mithu become her new best friend? Read this heartwarming story of friendship to find out!
children.author: Anupa Lal and Soumya Menon

children.title: First House
children.description: Long, long ago, when people lived in caves, two brothers in the northeastern part of India, now called Arunachal Pradesh, decided to build their own house. In a folktale that refers to the rich fauna of this region, we learn how the first house was built.
children.author: Nabanita Deshmukh and Phidi Pulu

children.title: The Generous Crow
children.description: The crow is not beautiful. He can neither sing as sweetly as a cuckoo nor dance as gracefully as a peacock. But he has one unique quality that we can all learn from. Read the book to find out what it is!
children.author: Venkatramana Gowda, Padmanabh, and Divaspathy Hegde

children.title: Shobhini and Nani
children.description: Little Shobhini loves trying out new things. She goes to the mela, the jungle and to bathe in the river with her adventurous Nani. They even fly off to the moon once…wonder what happened then. A lovely story about Shobhini and Nani's little adventures.
children.author: Sarvendra Vikram, Vibhash Pandey, and Rukmini Banerji

children.title: Jadav and the Tree-Place
children.description: Jadav has the best job in the world: he makes forests! How does he do it? Read this book to find out!
children.author: Vinayak Varma and Vinayak Varma

children.title: DIVE!
children.description: Take a dive with us into the spectacular world of coral reefs, and catch a glimpse of some strange and beautiful sea creatures!
children.author: Rajiv Eipe and Rajiv Eipe

children.title: The Boink Mystery
children.description: BOINK BOINK BOINK... Aman could hear it. What was 'it'? Read on to solve this great mystery set in Jantar Mantar in Jaipur. You are sure to have a lot of good clean fun!
children.author: Mala Kumar, Manisha Chaudhry, and Soumya Menon

children.title: Tok Tok
children.description: The food-loving king of Sonapur could not sleep because of a mysterious sound in his chambers. What could it be?
children.author: Vidya Pradhan and Reshma Barve

children.title: Nonkungu And The Imbulu
children.description: Nonkungu was going to visit her uncle and her mother gave her beautiful clothes to wear. On the way to her uncle's village,  Nonkungu meets a strange girl who wants to wear the lovely clothes.
children.author: Alan Kenyon, Viv Kenyon, and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: My First Day at the Market
children.description: On Etabo's sixth birthday,  his mother and aunt take him to town to visit the market for the first time.
children.author: Timothy Kabare, Ursula Nafula, and Catherine Groenewald

children.title: Lazy Anansi
children.description: The reason why spiders have long thin legs.
children.author: Ghanaian folktale and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: Goat, The False King
children.description: Now you know why goats are so stubborn!
children.author: Alice Nakasango and Marleen Visser

children.title: Magozwe
children.description: A boy finds himself on the street with other street children. This is a thoughtful,  challenging story about his life and how it begins to change for the better.
children.author: Lesley Koyi and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: King Of The Birds
children.description: The birds want a king,  but they have difficulty choosing. They decide that the bird that can fly highest will be made king. The African Vulture thinks he has won the contest,  but a tiny bird tricks him. Do the birds get their king?
children.author: South African Folktale and Wiehan de Jager

children.title: Grandma's Bananas
children.description: The little girl is curious as she watches her grandma preparing to ripen bananas.
children.author: Ursula Nafula and Catherine Groenewald

children.title: The Garbage Monster
children.description: The Garbage Monster
children.author: Layla Audi and Hanan Al-Karargy

children.title: The Fly Over the Pond
children.description: The Fly Over the Pond
children.author: Maria Daadouch and Kamal Sharaf

children.title: The mystery of the disappearing lamps
children.description: The mystery of the disappearing lamps
children.author: Mervat Al-Beltagi and Maya Abboud

children.title: The Diary of a Martian Kid
children.description: The Diary of a Martian Kid
children.author: Maria Daadouch and Basma Hussam

children.title: My Own Scooter
children.description: My Own Scooter
children.author: Ahmed Bin-Saeed and Sara Wafeeq

children.title: The Shuttle of Everlasting Youth
children.description: The Shuttle of Everlasting Youth
children.author: Maria Daadouch and Shaymaa Sobhi

children.title: Mr Spooky
children.description: Mr Spooky
children.author: Samar Al-Wakeel and Galal Ahmed

children.title: Aristotle the water bottle
children.description: Aristotle the water bottle
children.author: Lamis Asali and Kamal Sharaf

children.title: A feast in a special place
children.description: A feast in a special place
children.author: Amani Jazzia and Mona Mohammed

children.title: Knock, Knock Surprise
children.description: Knock, Knock Surprise
children.author: Safaa Saededdine and Shaymaa Sobhi

children.title: Bonney Vroom
children.description: Bonney Vroom
children.author: Mervat Al-Beltagi and Amir Al-Moghraby

children.title: Laylas Project
children.description: Laylas Project
children.author: Obai Al-Alloush and Basma Hussam

children.title: Grandpas Car
children.description: Grandpas Car
children.author: Doaa Othman and Shaymaa Sobhi

children.title: The Magic Broomstick
children.description: The Magic Broomstick
children.author: Yamam Khartash and Sara Wafeeq

children.title: Junior Runaway
children.description: Junior Runaway
children.author: Omaima Ezzedine and Mina Suleiman

children.title: Curious Lou
children.description: Curious Lou
children.author: Hegra Al-Sawi and Ahmed Shaltoot

children.title: A Beautiful Day

children.title: A House for Mouse
children.description: Mouse is looking for a new house. Friendly animals offer to share their homes with him. But nothing is right until he finds his own little spot, warm and cosy.
children.author: Michele Fry, Amy Uzzell, and Jennifer Jacobs

children.title: A Tiny Seed: The Story of Wangari Maathai
children.description: In a village on the slopes of Mount Kenya, a little girl worked in the fields with her mother. She worried as she saw the big forests disappearing, but she knew the power of a tiny seed.
children.author: Bookdash authors

children.title: Bathtub Safari
children.description: Jack’s bath time takes a wild turn as things in his bathtub start to change, and a group of animals becomes part of his adventurous bathtub safari!
children.author: Tracy Lynn Chemaly, Robert McEwan, and Sarah-Jane Williams

children.title: How About You?
children.description: You don’t need to be alike to be friends. When two very different children meet an unusual creature, it’s a chance to ask, How About You?
children.author: Renate van Rensburg, Margot Bertelsmann, and Ronèll Botes

children.title: Is There Anyone Like Me?
children.description: I wonder if there’s another me somewhere in the world…
children.author: Fred Strydom, Jess Jardim-Wedepohl, and Stephen Wallace

children.title: Karabo's Question
children.description: Little Karabo watches all the grown-ups in her family, and wonders, ‘What do I do? What do I know?’
children.author: Leisl Jobson, Natalie Propa, and Marike Beyleveld

children.title: Londi the dreaming girl
children.description: Londi loves to dream all day. But where will her dreams take her?
children.author: Lauren Holliday and Nathalie Koenig

children.title: Whose button is this?
children.description: Tinny Tim sets out on an adventure to return a lost button. Along the way he goes exploring, has a miraculous escape, and makes new friends.
children.author: Paul Kennedy, James Woolley, and Louise Gale

children.title: Zanele Situ: My Story: The Story of Zanele Situ
children.description: As a young girl Zanele Situ was told that she would never walk again. Being in a wheelchair did not stop her. She worked and trained hard and became a winning athlete on the world stage. This is her story…
children.author: Liz Sparg, Jesse Breytenbach, and Andy Thesen

children.title: A Dancer's Tale: The Story of Phyllis Spira
children.description: Phyllis Spira was dancing by the age of four. That was just the beginning of her journey towards becoming one of South Africa’s Prima Ballerinas.
children.author: Thea Nicole de Klerk, Samantha Cutler, and Roberto Pita

children.title: Come Back, Cat!
children.description: A delightful tale about an independent cat.
children.author: Nicola Rijsdijk, Karen Lilje, and Sam Scarborough

children.title: Miss Helen's Magical World: The Story of Helen Martins
children.description: This is the story of Helen Martins’ battle against darkness, told by one of the creatures she loved best, the wise old owl.
children.author: Jacqui L'Ange, Wendy Morison, and Nadene Kriel

children.title: Sima and Siza
children.description: Sima wants to be a nurse one day. His favourite game is hospital-hospital. But papa and his friends do not approve. What will change their minds?
children.author: Lwando Xaso and CClaire Ingram

children.title: Sleepy Mr Sloth
children.description: He’s quite good at climbing. He knows how to swing. But sleeping’s his favourite, favourite thing!
children.author: Paul Kennedy, Nick Mulgrew, and Graham Paterson

children.title: There Must be a Rainbow
children.description: In this delightful tale of hope, Jabulile’s dream of helping people comes true after a terrible storm hits the Valley.
children.author: Thulisizwe Mamba, Sinomonde Ngwane, and Nerissa Govender

children.title: Together We're Strong: The Story of Albertina Sisulu
children.description: From the day she was born to the day she died, Albertina Sisulu lived a life of love and sacrifice. A brave girl who rode a horse, she was a blessing to her family, to her community and to South Africa. This story of a unique and powerful woman, who stood up for her beliefs no matter what, will inspire and enchant.
children.author: Liesl Jobson, Alice Toich, and Nazli Jacobs

children.title: Amazing Daisy
children.description: On a little farm lives Daisy, a little chicken who wishes she could fly. All the other chickens laugh at her daily flying practice. But one day something amazing happens …
children.author: Nozizwe Herero, Siya Masuku, and Leona Ingram

children.title: Graca's Dream
children.description: The inspiring story of Graça Machel, and her dream to instill a love for reading and learning in the children of Mozambique and the rest of Africa.
children.author: Melissa Fagan, Karlien de Villiers, and Marike le Roux

children.title: Lory Dory
children.description: Lory Dory was born invisible. No one understands that she is real. Until, one day, she finds a way to show them who she is.
children.author: Sonia Dearling, Brendan O'Neill, and Arthur Attwell

children.title: Queen of Soweto: The Story of Basetsana Kumalo
children.description: Basetsana Kumalo is a beauty queen, but she’s also so much more. She teaches us that true beauty is about having a heart filled with love and generosity. Her story shows us that if you have courage and determination, you can achieve your dreams – whatever they may be.
children.author: Jessica Taylor, Mia du Plessis, and Marli Fourie

children.title: A Fish and A Gift
children.description: Yusuf waits on the beach while Papa pushes out his boat. Surfers, turtles and sharks come from the sea. What will Papa bring back for Yusuf?
children.author: Liesl Jobson, Jesse Breytenbach, and Andy Thesen

children.title: I Will Help You
children.description: When Mama Heron needs help, Lungile comes to her rescue.
children.author: Fathima Kathrada, Olivia Villet, and Andrea Abbott

children.title: Sbu's Special Shoes
children.description: Sbu’s little brother finds Sbu’s favourite shoes. When he tries them on, he discovers something very special about them.
children.author: Mark Hardie, Eidin Griffin, and Megan Pirie

children.title: Sizwe's Smile
children.description: Today Sizwe learns that a smile is something you can give away without losing it.
children.author: Vianne Venter, Genevieve Terblanche, and Lauren Rycroft

children.title: Thato's Birthday Surprise
children.description: It is one week until Thato’s Birthday. His mama tells him he will have a big surprise. What will it be?
children.author: Jodi Houareau, Brad Cuzen, and Corinne Lamoral-Rosmarin

children.title: Why is Nita upside down?
children.description: Nita’s hanging upside down. Can she turn the right way round?
children.author: Emma Hearne, Roxana Bouwer, and Sarah Bouwer

children.title: Grandpa's Gold
children.description: The children are talking about their grandpas. Giraffe’s grandpa can build a skyscraper. Elephant’s grandpa can cook a massive feast. But whose grandpa will give the children the biggest surprise?
children.author: Kerry Saadien-Raad, Elsabé Milandri, and Mathilde de Blois

children.title: Little Ant's Big Plan
children.description: This is a story about a little ant with a big plan, and how his love for reading saved the day.
children.author: Bookdash authors

children.title: Rafiki's Style
children.description: Rafiki’s style is all his own, but when the Cool Cat Crew struts by, he starts to wonder if it’s good enough.
children.author: Louis Greenberg, Audrey Anderson, and Wesley Thompson

children.title: Singing the Truth: The Story of Miriam Makeba
children.description: Learn about the amazing life of a little girl who grew up to use her gift of singing to help bring freedom to South Africa.
children.author: Jade Mathieson, Louwrisa Blaauw, and Bianca de Jong

children.title: Tortoise Finds His Home
children.description: Tortoise sets off in search of his house. Along the way, he meets new friends to help him. But the sky is darkening, and lightning flashes in the distance. Will Tortoise find his house in time?
children.author: Maya Fowler, Katrin Coetzer, and Damian Gibbs

children.title: Walking Together
children.description: A walk to the clinic doesn’t have to be dull, when there are so many wonderful things to see on the way.
children.author: Jade Mathieson, Louwrisa Blaauw, and Bianca de Jong

children.title: What if
children.description: Nandi is wondering all sorts of strange things about the world. And it begins with a simple question: What if…?
children.author: Julie Ann Smith-Belton, MaryAn Hampton, and Cristy Zinn
